website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if length in a monopod is your top priority; however the payoff is that it's a bit lacking when it comes to durability.
pros: Distances itself from others on our list for its 72" length that makes it perfect when you need a bit more space between you and your subjects
Not overly heavy, so it's not too awkward to carry
Easy to fold down when not in use
cons: Locking mechanism tends to come loose if you put too much pressure on the monopod, so you shouldn't lean on it
Has some plastic components that are flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Overall decent
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer, I teamed this with a plastic/rubber "V" gun mount for photographic use. I was hoping for a home run with it being strong/solid enough for a walking staff/trekking "pole" too, but unfortunately the locks aren't strong enough when you lean much weight on it. They are certainly strong enough for any photographic equipment I can think of, so I can hardly hold this against the product. The "V" mount makes a decent "handle"/grip for modest descents, stream crossings, etc. Just wish there was a way to tighten the locks for more stability. For the price, however, a very solid product. Would certainly be decent for a gun mount/monopod as well.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: A Good Compromise Between a Tripod and Freehanding
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my Nikon D3400. In many situations, a tripod is too cumbersome and time consuming. The monopod is a good compromise. It is light weight and when fully extended is long enough for a photographer who is seven feet tall (I am 6'3" and it is a fair amount longer than I need). It is much easier to work with than a tripod and it is very adequate for stabilizing the camera - even when using my largest telephoto lens (300 mm).
customer_reviews.author: inquiringmind

customer_reviews.title: Using for trilateration
customer_reviews.text: I bought a laser tape measure unit and found I could not hold it steady enough for surveying my property using trilateration. Needed something to keep it more steady. I didn't want to drag a tripod around the woods, so I tried the monopod. For a light aluminum tool, it is well built and feels relatively sturdy. The adjustment tabs keep the telescoping sections in place very nicely. It won't stand up to any abuse, but for helping steady a camera or other item it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Researcher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed a monopod for my 12x Nikon binoculars. They are quite heavy and my hands shake too much as I have gotten older. Purchased this along with a binocular tripod adapter. I am 6' 1" so I needed the 72 inch stick. This is long enough, stable enough, lightweight enough, and seems well made. Collapses to 22.5" so it is easy to store in my truck. Very satisfied for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: PickyBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great value, and tall enough (I'm 6 feet tall, no aching back after 2 baseball games!)
customer_reviews.text: This monopod is a GREAT value! I am 6' tall and had a tough time finding a monopod that was tall enough, but not too expensive. This one fits the bill perfectly. While I don't use the spiked foot much, it is a nice feature if the ground/grass is damp. I use this with a "Y" yoke attached (I don't attach a lens or body directly to the monopod) and it works well with long/heavy lenses. It is sturdy enough to use w/o concern, light enough to carry, and priced low enough that I didn't hesitate to buy. The supplied case wasn't that important to me, so I don't use it and have no comment. Overall: Good monopod, GREAT value.
customer_reviews.author: nomathjobs

customer_reviews.title: monopod
customer_reviews.text: great, very light, no flex at full length, I removed the 1 threaded shaft and replaced it with a 1/4 20 to fit camcorders and reversed it so now it is a extension pole for camcorders, a lot cheaper than a extension pole, no flex at full extended length, great buy
customer_reviews.author: discodj

customer_reviews.title: Monopod setup at a low cost.
customer_reviews.text: I puechased this item because of its 72 inch length. I also purchased Xinjue camera ball head. The two together provide an excellent monopod that allows the camera to assume a variety of positions. My camera is a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ1000 which is heavier than many SLR's.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a good monopod.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased mine to steady binoculars for stargazing. Using the adapter that came with my binoculars they work great together. 4 stars due the fact that the monopod is very lightweight. However, it fit my need, works as I expected, just use a bit of caution putting something heavy(expensive)on it, and you'll be fine. For the price, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: JimofSalem

customer_reviews.title: on the run, not time zoom on a tripod, or HD vid, give's that needed stability. for a moment or 5
customer_reviews.text: in kinda a hurry, on run,,, no time set up full tripod, just need stability on video or zoom pic, ,, need that extra sturdy, hold, but not time tripod, ,,, give's that needed stability for a quick, short time !!!
customer_reviews.author: david. p

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much based on price and the fact that Polaroid is a defunct brand, but this is a very nice monopod and it quite strong. Much better than I expected. I don't think I'll be needing another anytime soon. I'd purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Surprising quality for the price. At full extension there is no flexing, very rigid. Each of the four sections can be locked solidly and very securely. An excellent monopod equal or better than some I have looked at at 3X the price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W

customer_reviews.title: Good for a jeep safari
customer_reviews.text: We went on a tiger safari in India and and needed a monopod to hold my Canon Powershot 60HS. I am a newbie picture taker and, with a beanbag, used the polaroid to satisfaction when the jeep was stopped and I was shooting tigers that were a distance away.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Wiesner

customer_reviews.title: Seems better than I expected at this good price.
customer_reviews.text: This item just arrived and this is an initial review, so I can’t give it 5 stars just yet. It is light weight, but seems very sturdy. There are a couple pros that I didn’t remember that it would have, it is easy to change the bottom from rubber to a metal spike with just a simple twist or two. It also came a carrying case and shoulder strap. Can’t wait to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: John Cullinan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The monopd is very sturdy and you can almost use it like a walking stick. Unlike some other monopods, this extends to over 60 inches, so it is very convinient for taller individuals.
customer_reviews.author: EnEm

customer_reviews.title: I needed something to hold it steady and this is perfect for that
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pole mount for my 12X monocular. I needed something to hold it steady and this is perfect for that. It is very lightweight and folds up neatly. It comes with a carrier bag to make toting it around very easy. I also ordered an inexpensive pivoting head for it (coming via Hong Kong Post) Everything I need in an inexpensive package. I can use it to star gaze to find out if the view warrants getting out my heavy duty binocs and tripod. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: USA

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly as described. This helps stabilize my pictures, especially when shooting at athletic events. I hope this will also helps with night shooting, but I haven't had a chance to experiment with that aspect yet.
customer_reviews.author: SKY

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and as described
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed, modifying it to serve as a banner-flag pole. The spike in the bottom isn't supposed to come off, but I got it out with a bit of effort. It came with a carry bag and is lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Arichelic

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A STICK!!
customer_reviews.text: This monopod exceeded my expectations. It is build very solid and could be used very easily as a walking stick. I combined it with a  for photographing wildlife. It can be used very effectively without extending the bottom extension do to the 72" overall length. I believe it is the best you can purchase for the money. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JMAC

customer_reviews.title: Definatly a good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my first monopod so I went with one of the cheapet ones. It is easy to adjust and use. Lightweight with a comfortable hand grip.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a tall person
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for anyone short or tall. I purchased this because I’m 6’6” And was tired of leaning over to shoot. It can extend well past my head and doesn’t slip down with heavy weight on it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Monopod for my dSLR
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this briefly on a few occasions but I like how it preforms. Easy to adjust to desired height. My only concern is the durability of the clamps. I suspect they will weaken with time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry around.
customer_reviews.text: Stable and sturdy enough to handle my DSLR camera and my Gopro at the same time without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: ka2000ha

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, but durable!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about how "Ultra Heavy Duty" this monopod is, but it is, IMO, a great value! It is light weight and hasn't broken yet. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: GlueFactoryBJJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect & ood quality.. I do insurance inspections & it's exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: David Lamb Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It works excellent. Great price. I wish it compacted shorter, but it excellent.
customer_reviews.author: edward

customer_reviews.title: Great monopod for the ballpark
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tripod to use at sporting events since ballparks here don't allow tripods. This works great. It's well made, light and extends to great height. If you're looking for a nice monopod at a reasonable price, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. BosargeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price amazing sizes amazing value !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 foot 5 inches tall and wanted a monopod its my first one and I did not want to spend too much money so i found this one and was not exspecting much from it sense all the others that i found at stores and online fit in a 60-80 dollar range,I am very happy with this monopod its sturdy at full length and is as good or better then the more exspensive ones I will be buying another one for my wife sense I love the one I got.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Shubert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have taken this unit on one vacation trip and I have no complaints. It worked just as it was intended. I would like it better if it collapsed to a smaller size, and if it had a pan/swivel head instead of just a tripod screw, but I knew about those issues going in. The extension sections and the lock clamps worked well for me. Most of my video came out rock steady using this monopod.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I get one of these sooner
customer_reviews.text: For under $20, I'm very very happy. Just the idea of a monopod wasn't something I'd considered for the longest time, but if you do a lot of field work, in my case with a Canon XF100, this saves you the chore of lugging around a heavy tripod. You can still get reasonably good pans with a little finesse and the freedom to move around so quickly and easily is the real advantage.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Polaroid 72" Photo / Video Pro Ultra Heavy Duty Monopod
customer_reviews.text: Strong, durable Monopod work on Osmo Mobile 3 and DSLR Camera.****
customer_reviews.author: MLochmatow

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stick
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, quality, sturdy, well made Unipod. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: mntnmn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect item
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to carry and works very well on the go. Exactly what I needed and great price and durability.

customer_reviews.title: I was able to replace it with a better screw, other then that the monopod is well ...
customer_reviews.text: I broke of the 1/4-20 screw the first time I mounted my camera, I was able to replace it with a better screw, other then that the monopod is well built and nice and tall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Feels great and solid. used this to film some football games and is well made

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The product is well made. The height is easy to adjust. The bottom allows you to use the rubber bottom or the steel point. The only thing to consider is if you want an adjustable swivel on top. It is so easy to adjust the height that it isn't a problem for me. The carrying sleeve is really nice as well. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Rush

customer_reviews.title: Great Monopod

It also comes in a zipper case and is small enough to pack when fully collapsed.

customer_reviews.title: A Good Addition

Set up is quick, adjustments are easy and portability is much better than with most tripods. The light weight aluminum has the feel of being very supportive, but very easy to move.

Would highly recommend.

Buy a cheap monopod, you will get a cheap monopod. 1. feels flimsy. 2. lower sections will not stay extended / locked. 3. the ends of the hand strap are clued together, not sewn. better to spend a few extra bucks and get a quality monopod, rather than buying this one and another two weeks later.

customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well made. A nice light weight alternative to a tripod. Comes with a nice carry case. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sove

product_meta.title: Polaroid 72" Photo / Video Pro Ultra Heavy Duty Monopod For Digital Cameras & Camcorders
product_meta.description:
Polaroid 72 inch Photo / Video Pro Ultra Heavy Duty Monopod For Digital Cameras & Camcorders

POLAROID 72 INCH PHOTO / VIDEO PRO ULTRA HEAVY DUTY MONOPOD FOR DIGITAL CAMERAS & CAMCORDERS

Regardless if you're a casual photographer/videographer or a serious "prosumer" there's a Polaroid tripod designed with your needs in mind. 

That's because we design our tripods with intelligent in-demand features like fluid pan-head, braced center columns, all-terrain leg tips, dual levels, compact-footprints, ergonomically designed carry handles and foam grips-and everything else you'd expect from a tripod line inspired by over half a century of imaging innovation. And to ensure they're part of your "accessory arsenal" for the long term, we've crafted them from industrial grade, lightweight aluminum to ensure they always keep your valuable equipment on solid ground.

No matter if you choose our ultra compact desktop models, our unique monopod or our ruggedized all terrain models, you'll immediately understand why Polaroid tripods are considered the ultimate in "classic image stabilization"

 * Perfect For Situations When You Need Long Exposures Yet Are Short On Space
 * High Density No Sweat Foam Grip For Increased Stability Quad-Section, Solid Aluminum Leg Features Stay Set Locking Mechanism
 * Commercial Grade Rubber Tip With Retractable Spike <> Includes Carrying Case
 * Compact And Lightweight For Take Anywhere Convenience Yet Extends To 72
 * Standard Tripod Mount Accepts Virtually All Cameras/Camcorders, Slave Lights, Remote Devices, Boom Mikes, ETC

POLAROID 72 INCH PHOTO / VIDEO PRO ULTRA HEAVY DUTY MONOPOD FOR DIGITAL CAMERAS & CAMCORDERS
Leg Diameter: 25.8mm

Net Weight: 2.23 lbs. 

Folded Length: 23.85 inch

Extended Length: 72 inch
feature_bullets: Perfect for situations when you need long exposures yet are short on space

Quad-section, solid aluminum leg features stay-set locking mechanism
Commercial grade rubber tip with retractable spike
Compact and lightweight for take-anywhere convenience, yet it extends to 72"
